meanings.definition: A game in which players take turns jumping over each other
meanings.sent1: During recess, the children played leapfrog in the schoolyard.
meanings.sent2: The siblings enjoyed a friendly game of leapfrog in the park.
meanings.sent3: The frogs decided to play leapfrog to see who could jump the highest.
meanings.sent4: The cars on the highway moved like leapfrogging dancers, one passing the other.
meanings.sent5: The image of the kangaroo hopping reminded her of a game of leapfrog.

meanings.definition: To move forward by jumping over something
meanings.sent1: The athlete had to leapfrog over the hurdles to reach the finish line.
meanings.sent2: The cat tried to leapfrog over the fence to chase the squirrel.
meanings.sent3: The rabbit attempted to leapfrog over the log but got stuck halfway.
meanings.sent4: She had to leapfrog over the puddles to avoid getting her shoes wet.
meanings.sent5: The ninja had to leapfrog over the laser beams to reach the treasure.

meanings.definition: To progress quickly or surpass others in a competitive situation
meanings.sent1: The company managed to leapfrog its competitors by introducing innovative products.
meanings.sent2: The student worked hard to leapfrog to the top of the class rankings.
meanings.sent3: The tortoise decided to leapfrog ahead of the hare in the race.
meanings.sent4: Her career started to leapfrog after she received the prestigious award.
meanings.sent5: The rocket's speed allowed it to leapfrog past all other spacecraft in the race to Mars.
